image.altText: Former AFL player Eddie Betts stands in a suit on stage in front of a microphone during an awards ceremony.

props.synopsis: Police confirm they have received a report into racial abuse, after Eddie Betts posted security footage of his kids being yelled at from a car in Melbourne.

title.children: Police investigating after Eddie Betts posts security footage of his kids being racially abused in their yard

image.altText: woman smiling wearing t-shirt in building with balloons background

props.synopsis: Rosanna Natoli has won the race to lead one of Queensland's largest councils, and will serve alongside her husband Joe Natoli who has been re-elected as a councillor.

title.children: TV presenter declared Sunshine Coast mayor

image.altText: Richard Marles in a suit with yellow tie shakes hands with a man with grey hair dressed in a suit.

props.synopsis: South Korea's new ambassador to Australia has resigned after less than a month in the job, as he faces a corruption probe at home.

title.children: South Korea's ambassador to Australia resigns after less than a month in the job

image.altText: Mr Karagania is holding a packet of fish, standing in a fish market.

props.synopsis: From "blessed" church gatherings, to a family picnic and Easter egg hunt, and seafood-focused feasts — here's how locals are marking Good Friday.

title.children: How Australia is spending Good Friday

image.altText: D'Arenberg chief winemaker Chester Osborn.

props.synopsis: While wine authorities say getting Australian exports to China back to pre-tariff levels could be "a matter of years", many in the industry are not only rejoicing, but getting set to resume shipments.

title.children: 'Great Friday' for winemakers ready to 'instantly' resume shipments of China-bound drops

image.altText: Scenes from a shooting incident in Cairns Botanic Gardens

props.synopsis: Queensland police find two of the three people involved in an incident that saw a gunshot fired and an emergency declaration enforced.

title.children: Man in hospital with gunshot wound after Cairns car crash

image.altText: Luke Beveridge

props.synopsis: Luke Beveridge hits out at the AFL's controversial policy of advising players to overstate injuries after testing positive to illicit drugs.

title.children: Bulldogs coach takes aim at AFL drugs policy for failure to protect players who don't take drugs

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy standing at a lectern, in front of a NT Police banner.

props.synopsis: NT Police has arrested two more people over an attack on the Todd Tavern in the Alice Springs CBD this week, and a third person who allegedly assaulted police in a separate incident.

title.children: More arrests over Alice Springs unrest as youth curfew continues

image.altText: A photo of a man holding a phone displaying whatsapp messages.

props.synopsis: When Paul called ING with a question about his cryptocurrency investment, the bank's scam team was alerted. Now, after losing nearly $500,000 to a romance scam, Paul argues the bank could have stopped it.

title.children: Dianna messaged Paul out of the blue. What looked like happiness cost him nearly $500k

image.altText: A Brisbane Broncos player stands and yells in celebration with a teammate as rain falls in a game against the Cowboys.

props.synopsis: It's time for an all-Queensland clash, with the Broncos hosting the Cowboys at Lang Park, after South Sydney gets off the mark for 2024 with a bruising win over the Bulldogs. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Broncos on top after frantic first half at Lang Park, Rabbitohs beat the Bulldogs

image.altText: Older white male named Len James wearing black polo shirt, cream shorts and glasses sits on a public bench in Perth city.

props.synopsis: Experts say the design of public furniture, like park benches, is becoming increasingly hostile — and its having a big impact on our most vulnerable people.

title.children: 'They didn't want me there': How hostile architecture is just another thing homeless people have to deal with

image.altText: Palestinian children in a queue holding saucepans

props.synopsis: The World Court has ordered Israel to "take all necessary and effective" action to ensure access to food and medical supplies for Gaza's Palestinian population in an effort to improve the humanitarian situation.

title.children: 'Famine is setting in': World Court orders Israel to open more land crossings to allow aid into Gaza

image.altText: A hand reaches across a table full of cheese, dip, cured meat and other snack foods to pick a snack.

props.synopsis: If you're looking for an easy meal to share with family or friends, this option has minimal prep, can accommodate any dietary requirements and is quick to clean up.

title.children: Affordable and infinitely adaptable: Platters are the perfect fuss-free meals

image.altText: A man in uniform carrying a large gun stands on a road at night, looking at the camera

props.synopsis: If last Friday night's deadly ambush at the Crocus City Hall near Moscow proved anything, it's that while Islamic State might be down, it's certainly not out.

title.children: 'Slaughtering civilians with gusto': How Islamic State was forced to change

image.altText: A magpie

props.synopsis: When we think of birds mimicking sounds, we typically think of some kind of parrot, lyrebird or maybe even a cockatoo. However, magpies are among the best of the sound-sampling songbirds out there.

title.children: This Brisbane magpie can make the sound of a blaring siren — but that's not unusual

image.altText: Multi-coloured foil-covered chocolate eggs in a straw basket

props.synopsis: This year, the Easter long weekend falls on the last weekend of March. That's because of a decision made all the way back in the year 325.

title.children: Thrown off by the timing of Easter? Here's why the public holiday dates are earlier this year

image.altText: A Black man shovels a pile of dried cocoa beans from a wooden box.

props.synopsis: Over the last few years, a peculiar change has taken place in Papua New Guinea's north-west, with remote, traditional villages modernising at a rapid pace. Here's how the price of cocoa is fuelling development.

title.children: Inside this brightly coloured pod is white slimy gold. Tiny PNG villages are cashing in

image.altText: Roe Creek near Alice Springs

props.synopsis: Southern Australia can expect ideal weather over the Easter break until at least Monday, when rain that has been pummelling parts of the NT moves south.

title.children: Ideal Easter weather across southern Australia before outback soaking moves south

image.altText: Deadly crash in SA

props.synopsis: An eight-year-old child is the only survivor after a bus in South Africa plunged into a ravine and caught fire, officials say.

title.children: 45 killed in bus crash in South Africa after vehicle plunges off bridge

image.altText: Imogen Mulgrew tosses the coin for Jy Simpkin and Patrick Cripps

props.synopsis: Fremantle and Adelaide clash in the west, after Carlton made light work of North Melbourne in their Good Friday fixture at Docklands. Follow live.

title.children: Heartwarming coin toss moment steals the show as Blues down Roos, Dockers battle Crows

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 3QT: Dockers lead by 10, but haven't shut the door on Crows
HT: Dockers find an edge and lead Crows by eight points
QT: Crows lead a scrappy one by three points

image.altText: A wide red dirt road with houses in background and children's toy in foreground

props.synopsis: Many towns across northern Australia feel Alice Springs is holding up a mirror to their own problems with youth crime. Could a curfew be a solution to their challenges?

title.children: Alice Springs is the canary in the coal mine for other troubled Australian towns

image.altText: Wine harvest Australia good generic

props.synopsis: Wine producers welcome an end to Chinese tariffs, with some Australian wines expected to hit shelves in China within days.

title.children: 'It's a crisis': Australian winemakers hail axing of Chinese tariffs, but warn it's no quick fix

image.altText: A composite image of a cargo ship crashing into a bridge, Princess Catherine and a performer dancing on stage.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly News Quiz: Baltimore's boat crash, Splendour cancelled and Kate's diagnosis

image.altText: dog in tent with lady and son

props.synopsis: Learning basic pet first aid skills could help save your pet's life, especially if you are kilometres from the nearest vet.

title.children: Camping with your dog this Easter? These are the dangers lurking at campsites

image.altText: woman looking to her right

props.synopsis: Macalie Adamson spent 18 years using the drug ice, culminating in a near-death experience and homelessness. Now, almost six years into sobriety, she's using her experience to open more conversations about drug use and rehabilitation.

title.children: Easter once came with 'intense fear', but now Macalie is helping others find peace

image.altText: Woman wearing glasses in red top leans back in chair with laptop in lap and notebook in hand

props.synopsis: With a youth curfew now in place in Alice Springs, there are questions over what powers the police will have to keep kids off the streets overnight.

title.children: 'Some of these children are homeless': Legal concerns raised over Alice Springs curfew

image.altText: King Charles shakes hands with UK PM. The king is smilling at him.

props.synopsis: King Charles III praises people who "extend the hand of friendship, especially in a time of need" in a recorded message delivered to a pre-Easter church service, which the monarch missed as he continued to undergo cancer treatment.

title.children: King Charles stresses importance of friendship 'in a time of need' after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A young man with brown curly hair wearing a suit walks on the street.

props.synopsis: A New York judge sentences Sam Bankman-Fried for stealing $US8 billion from customers of the now-bankrupt FTX exchange he founded.

title.children: Sam Bankman-Fried sentenced to 25 years in jail over FTX fraud

image.altText: Four wheel drive vehicle travelling through a desert landscape

props.synopsis: With Easter marking the unofficial start of the tourist season, outback authorities are concerned by the number of people getting lost or stuck in Queensland's outback after following location mapping apps.

title.children: Authorities tell tourists 'don't just rely on Google Maps' while travelling through outback Queensland

image.altText: Gates of Harvard University in America

props.synopsis: Prestigious Harvard University has removed human skin from the binding of a book held for over 90 years at one of its libraries.

title.children: Harvard removes human skin binding from book after more than 90 years

image.altText: An aerial drone photo shows the construction of a long suspension bridge.

props.synopsis: Palm Sunday in the Philippines, Chinese rocket launches and a Japanese 'poo' museum — the Asia Pacific this week in pictures.

title.children: In 20 pictures: Stories you may have missed from the Asia Pacific this week

image.altText: Loch Hart festival director Jayden Bath with his partner Tess Birch

props.synopsis: As festivals around Australia struggle to remain viable, one regional event is bucking the trend with a unique early-access subscription model.

title.children: Music festival offers pre-paid subscriptions to fend off Splendour-like cancellation

image.altText: Generic image of an elderly woman's wrinkled hands

props.synopsis: With 69 per cent of residential aged care homes running at a loss, many hope the federal government will fully fund a recent pay rise awarded to the sector's workers.

title.children: Aged care workers will soon get a massive pay rise, but can providers afford it?

image.altText: Steve Martin looks slightly to the right as he sits at a table with his arms crossed in front of him, a pensive look on his face

props.synopsis: Morgan Neville's poignant documentary explores the cultural phenomenon that is Steve Martin.

title.children: New doco exploring the life of comedy legend Steve Martin will have you in your feelings
